thread.title: HTC One X10 live images leaked, all-metal body and fingerprint sensor in tow | 91mobiles.com
thread.title_full: HTC One X10 live images leaked, all-metal body and fingerprint sensor in tow | 91mobiles.com

title: HTC One X10 live images leaked, all-metal body and fingerprint sensor in tow | 91mobiles.com
text:
HTC One X10 live images leaked, all-metal body and fingerprint sensor in... HTC One X10 live images leaked, all-metal body and fingerprint sensor in tow By - February 20, 2017 “The One X10 will allegedly sport a 5.5-inch FHD display, an octa-core SoC and a 16.3MP rear camera” 
Last month, popular gadget tipster Evan Blass aka @ evleaks posted an alleged render of the upcoming HTC One X10 smartphone. Now a couple of live images of the phone have surfaced on the Chinese social networking platform Weibo. 
The HTC One X10’s purported live images suggest that the phone will flaunt a premium metal unibody design. It will feature a fingerprint sensor, which will be located right below the primary shooter. The handset will offer a dual-LED flash and capacitive buttons for navigation. The tipster also suggests that the phone will be priced at RMB 1,680 (~Rs 16,360). 
As per the earlier reports, the HTC One X10 will feature a 5.5-inch full HD display, and will be powered by a 1.9GHz octa-core MediaTek processor. It will get 3GB of RAM, 32GB of expandable storage, a 16.3MP rear camera, a 7.9MP front shooter and Android Nougat. The device is expected to be unveiled by the end of the month.
